intro: Heisteria yapacaniensis, commonly known as the Yapacani heisteria, is a flowering plant native to Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
